ATS Check COD solenoid valve healthiness As found condition: COD waste accumulate and solenoid waste valve does not open.  Actions taken during Resolve Myself, Do Troubleshooting and Advance Troubleshooting: 1)Verify status: Analyzer in reading process. 2)Analyzer could not drain waste product. 3)Found the COD Waste solenoid valve does not open when tested with "open" signal. 4)Stop analyzer so the syringe does not over-work pushing waste.  Findings/ Observations during Resolve Myself, Do Troubleshooting and Advance Troubleshooting: Mixture dosent move in syringe cell when syringe pushing product out.  Source of Problem: Waste solenoid dosent open.  As left condition: Unit in service.  PKP and Troubleshooter name & contact number : Khairul Fazli (go together with M ADIB)  Advance Troubleshooting eLog Number: M ADIB (013-4677523)  Special Tools/ Service/ Equipment required: Chemical PPE, first aid.  Attachments: N/A  Equipment operation need date: As soon as possible.  Rectification Window:  Remarks: work request ABT C&I to check COD waste solenoid healthiness *Workscope: 1)Force release waste product by release waste tube from solenod valve 2)Check for leak 3)Test "open" and "close" with tubing released. 4)If no change, to test solenoid power supply. 5)If no abnormality, restart analyzer and observer finding. ATR: -Visual check no leakage. -Stroking check as found stuck at 27%. -Calibrate zero,and stroking check valve can be operate until 40% after calibrate. -Verify command from DCS to i/p good.4-20mA receive. -Suspect i/p problem.  Work Request: To replace i/p, replace positioner due the old positioner obsolete, and retighten packing.  Remark: Picture of minor leak as per picture attached. Excess DEMIN Return Line (122FIA-2A11-TX Excess DEMIN Return Line (122FIA-2A11-TX) reading was badly fluctuated.  1st line t/shooting: Transmitter was located at high side. Return line DEMIN water tank CV (122PCV-2A04-IC) was on manual mode and in closed position. No flow should be reflected at FIA-2A11, however, reading was shown and badly fluctuated. CV was confirmed not passing as we had closed manual valve before the flow transmitter (122FIA-2A11-TX). Trending as per attachment list.  Troubleshooter: C&I t/shooter found output card problem. Need to replace new card. MBE E VENT VALVE LINE CLOGGED Work Request Task: To request C&I to open valve EXVY-2A18 to remove any trap media/rubber lining at valve due to low air flow  Tag no and description: EXVY-2A18  Air Vent Valve  1st line troubleshooting: OPN- 1. When normal regen step, during air mixed 1, ( XVY-2A17 and XVY-2A18 open, the flow is only 360 m3/hr                                                                        2. When PO open the backwash outlet valve XVY-2A11, the flow increase to required flow, 525 m3/hr. 3. Vent valve indication is fully open. MBE-E is the bed with the new rubber lining.  Troubleshooter finding: Observed by Azizi C&I: 1. When DCS give command open, valve fully open. And when command close from DCS, valve is fully close. Suspect venting line is clog.  Remarks: Air flow is low during regen air mixed step caused the blower to trip. MBE F NO FLOW DURING ACID INJECTION STEP MBE F NO FLOW DURING ACID INJECTION STEP  Problem Statement: MBE F no flow during acid injection step causing high concentration and regen failed to complete sequence. Suspect acid valve, 122FXVY-2A13 failed to open.  1st Line T/Shooting: 1) OPN stroke acid valve, 122FXVY-2A13 valve from DCS. Status of valve opening okay. 2) OPN open drain valve, concentration of flow high. 3) Suspect valve stuck but actuator show open.  ATR: -As per confirm with panel operator,during regen MBE M no issue using the same pipe line. -But regen MBE-F the pump trip . -Suspect the valve diaphragm not good inside the valve body. -As per visual inspection the valve and SOV also badly corroded. -Advice to raise notification to replace this valve and SOV. -Valve size DN50. MBE L: CAUSTIC VALVE 122LXVY-2A12 MULFUN MBE L: CAUSTIC VALVE 122LXVY-2A12 MULFUNCTION DURING REGEN.  1st Line T/S: 1. Valve sudden close during regen step pre-heat and can\'t proceed regen. 2. Valve indication at site closed by FO. 3. Indication at DCS show valve faulty by PO. 4. Pressure show 5.7kg/cm2. 5. FO perform visual inspection and found no abnormality conditions. 6. OPN suspect SV problem & raise ATR to C&I: eLOG-UK-DEMIN2-20-00687.  Finding T/Shooter: 1. C&I (Noor Azlan) found breaker trip at mdf 805,root cause why valve sudden close. 2. At side found leakage at body and the leakage direct to the SOV,root cause breaker trip at mdf. 3. C&I advice OPN to raise notification for replace new valve. 4. Size valve body DN50 PN 10,Flange rating 2"150.  Work Request: 1. OPN raise SAP. 2. OPN request C&I to replace new valve & update ATR.  Remark: 1. Refer to the picture as per attach. Troubleshooter: As found QIA-410-tx, -Sensor dirty -Reading deviate  with portable  -Reading not tally with DCS.(Range at tx 4-10pH) As left: -Clean sensor cover and sensor with demin water. -Re-range the transmitter back to 0-14 ph simillar to DCS range, -Recalibrate pH anlyzer with buffer calibration pH7&pH10. -Normalize back sensor,reading transmitter 7.49pH DCS,portable 7.78pH,deviate 0.29pH,panel not accepted the diviation.  As found QIA-409-tx, -Sensor dirty -Sensor cover not install. -Reading deviate  with portable.  -Reading not tally with DCS.(Range at tx 0-13.5pH) As left: -Clean sensor with demin water. -Re-range the transmitter back to 0-14 ph simillar to DCS range, -Recalibrate pH anlyzer with buffer calibration pH7&pH10. -Normalize back sensor,reading transmitter 7.02pH DCS,portable 7.78pH,deviate 0.76pH,panel not accepted the diviation. ASU2 GAN Comp IGV cannot fully closed ASU2 GAN Compressor IGV cannot fully closed  1st line troubleshooting - Observed during startup after trip incident on 16 May 2018  Intergrated troubleshooting: - CNI & MROT troubleshooter performed rectification by dismantling actuator linkage with IGV and performed stroke test. Actuator movement found OK, 0% to 100%. Re-coupled, stroke test still found stuck at 17%. Performed actuator stopper & travel adjustment. Managed to get 0% IGV feedback opening. - Advice to perform servicing and calibration during shutdown opportunity.  Note: Func loc was tag for Tx. Cannot found the IGV tag in the system.
